intro: Pentacalia encanoana, commonly known as the Encanoan pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Brazil. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, and thrives in humid climates. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, hairy texture, contributing to its unique botanical appearance. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
